about_the_game:
Experience a complex classic on Austrian rails with RSSLO’s authentic ÖBB 1063 for Train Simulator!

Built in the early 1980s, the ÖBB 1063 was designed in response to the previous decade’s oil crisis, citing that more electric locomotives were needed for shunting duties, replacing costly diesel counterparts. The only electric shunters of the time were rather dated, their technology coming from 30 years prior, and ÖBB needed something much more modern, capable of forming and breaking up trains in yards much faster than was possible at the time.

The prototype was found in the E 1200 series, which went through extensive testing in 1979, following which an eventual 50 production locomotives would be produced, the last rolling out the factory in 1991. Featuring a central driving cab, the ÖBB 1063 is perfectly suited for shunting operations, offering a panoramic view of freight yards and equidistant perspectives of nearby rolling stock.

Despite their age, only a handful of ÖBB 1063s have been retired, with many still in use today on various shunting duties throughout Austria, and thanks to RSSLO, you can experience this locomotive in true form within Train Simulator!

Pro Range


The Pro Range is aimed toward the serious train simulation enthusiast looking for a complex machine to master. Each product is designed to provide education and entertainment for users. Xbox controller and HUD interface support do not come as standard and users will need to read the accompanying documentation to fully understand the operation of this advanced simulation

Included Scenarios


A trio of engaging Career scenarios are included for the Tirol: Brenner - Kufstein route:

  • Coal from Jenbach
  • Freight for Innsbruck
  • Morning Passenger Train

More scenarios are available on the Steam Workshop online and in-game. Train Simulator’s Steam Workshop scenarios are free and easy to download, adding many more hours of exciting gameplay. With scenarios being added daily, why don’t you check it out now!

Key Features


  • ÖBB 1063 Electric Shunter Locomotive in ÖBB Red livery
  • Authentic cab and controls
  • Realistic start-up and changing console sequences
  • Distance-activated SIFA system
  • Classic I 60 PZB system
  • Interactive Radio Panel
  • True-to-life brake test procedure
  • 3 Career Scenarios for Tirol: Brenner - Kufstein
  • Quick Drive compatible
  • Download size: 76.1mb

Experience a complex classic on Austrian rails with RSSLO’s authentic ÖBB 1063 for Train Simulator!

Built in the early 1980s, the ÖBB 1063 was designed in response to the previous decade’s oil crisis, citing that more electric locomotives were needed for shunting duties, replacing costly diesel counterparts. The prototype was found in the E 1200 series, which went through extensive testing in 1979, following which an eventual 50 production locomotives would be produced, the last rolling out the factory in 1991. Featuring a central driving cab, the ÖBB 1063 is perfectly suited for shunting operations, offering a panoramic view of freight yards and equidistant perspectives of nearby rolling stock.

Despite their age, only a handful of ÖBB 1063s have been retired, with many still in use today on various shunting duties throughout Austria, and thanks to RSSLO, you can experience this locomotive in true form within Train Simulator!

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum for 32-bit:
  • OS *: 32-bit Windows 7 Service Pack 1, 8.1 or 10 Required (Other OS versions and types are not supported)
  • Processor: Intel Core-i3 4330 3.50 GHz Dual Core or AMD A8 6600K 3.90 GHz Quad Core or Better
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 750 Ti or AMD Radeon R9 Graphics with 1 GB Dedicated VRAM or Better
  • DirectX®: 9.0c
  • Network: Broadband Connection (May incur additional costs for use)
  • Storage: 40 GB or more available space (Additional Add-Ons will require more)
  • Sound Card: DirectX Compatible Audio Device
  • Additional Notes: Requires mouse and keyboard or Xbox Controller
Laptop, Notebook, Mobile or Low Power versions of the above specifications (including Intel or Integrated Graphics) may work but are not supported. Updates to Chipset, Graphics and Audio Device Drivers may be required. For information relating to recommended specifications for Train Simulator 64-bit, please refer to the Train Simulator 2022 User Guide.
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended for 32-bit:
  • OS *: 32- or 64-bit Windows 7 Service Pack 1, 8.1 or 10 Required (Other OS versions and types are not supported)
  • Processor: Intel Core-i5 4690 3.50 GHz Quad Core or AMD Ryzen 7 1700 3.80 GHz Quad Core or Better
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM (maximum possible under 32-bit Windows)/16 GB or Better (For 64-bit Windows)
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 970 or AMD Radeon RX 480 with 4 GB Dedicated VRAM or Better
  • DirectX®: 9.0c
  • Network: Broadband Connection (May incur additional costs for use)
  • Storage: High Performance SSD Recommended with 40 GB or more available space (Additional Add-Ons will require more)
  • Sound Card: DirectX Compatible Audio Device
  • Additional Notes: Requires mouse and keyboard or Xbox Controller
Laptop, Notebook, Mobile or Low Power versions of the above specifications (including Intel or Integrated Graphics) may work but are not supported. Updates to Chipset, Graphics and Audio Device Drivers may be required. For information relating to recommended specifications for Train Simulator 64-bit, please refer to the Train Simulator 2022 User Guide.
